page.title: 4th convocation of the People's Assembly of Abkhazia

revision.text:
The '''4th convocation of the People's Assembly of Abkhazia''' was in place from [[Abkhazian parliamentary election, 2007|2007]] until [[Abkhazian parliamentary election, 2012|2012]].
==Speaker and Vice Speakers==
The first session of the 4th convocation of the People's Assembly was held on 3 April 2007. It was opened by the oldest deputy, [[Vladimir Nachach]] and attended by President [[Sergei Bagapsh]], Vice President [[Raul Khajimba]], Prime Minister [[Alexander Ankvab]], Supreme Court Head Rauf Korua, Arbitration Court Head A. Gurjua, the deputies of the previous convocation, the members of the Cabinet and regional Administration Heads.<ref name=apress0704>{{cite news|title=Новости из Абхазии|url=http://www.kapba.de/News-R-Aprel2007.html|accessdate=18 February 2012|newspaper=[[Apsnypress]]|date=April 2007}}</ref>
During the first session, [[Nugzar Ashuba]] was re-elected to the position of speaker with 26 votes. He had been nominated by Vladimir Nachach, he defeated [[Adgur Kharazia]] who had been nominated by [[Rita Lolua]].<ref name=apress0704/><ref name=apsnypress070403b>{{cite web |url = http://www.apsnypress.info/news2007/april/3.htm |title = Нугзар Ашуба вновь избран спикером парламента. |publisher = [[Apsnypress]] |date = 3 April 2007 |accessdate = 17 August 2009 }}</ref>
The number of Vice Speakers was expanded from two to three. For the first position, Nugzar Ashuba nominated [[Viacheslav Tsugba]] for re-election, and [[Batal Kobakhia]] [[Irina Agrba]], arguing that it was time for a woman to be elected. Parliament then accepted a legislative amendment proposed by President Bagapsh allowing for a total number of three Vice Speakers, so that both could be elected. For the third position, [[Albert Ovsepyan]] was nominated for re-election by [[Valeri Kondakov]], while opposition member [[Adgur Kharazia]] nominated [[Sergei Matosyan]]. After a heated debate and President Bagapsh expressing his support for Ovsepyan, the latter was re-elected with 19 votes.<ref name=apress0704/><ref name=apsnypress070403c>{{cite web |url = http://www.apsnypress.info/news2007/april/3.htm |title = В новом Парламенте – три вице-спикера. |publisher = [[Apsnypress]] |date = 3 April 2007 |accessdate = 17 August 2009 }}</ref>
On 3 May 2010, Albert Ovsepyan retired as Vice Speaker on account of old age.<ref name="apress100503">{{cite web|title=Выпуск №245-246|url=http://www.apsnypress.info/news2010/Mai/03.htm|work=[[Apsnypress]]|accessdate=19 May 2010|language=Russian|date=3 May 2010}}</ref> On 24 September, [[Sergei Matosyan]] was elected Vice Speaker in his stead.<ref name="apress1616">{{cite web|title=Депутаты парламента избрали на должность вице-спикера парламента Героя Абхазии- Сергея Матосян|url=http://apsnypress.info/news/1616.html|work=[[Apsnypress]]|accessdate=19 January 2011|language=Russian|date=24 September 2010}}</ref>
==Changes in composition==
On 10 June 2008 deputy [[Omar Kvarchia]] suddenly died.<ref name=apsnypress080611>{{cite web |url = http://www.apsnypress.info/news2008/June/11.htm |title = СКОРОПОСТИЖНО СКОНЧАЛСЯ ДЕПУТАТ ПАРЛАМЕНТА АБХАЗИИ, ПРЕДСЕДАТЕЛЬ КОМИТЕТА ПО БЮДЖЕТУ, КРЕДИТНЫМ ОРГАНИЗАЦИЯМ, НАЛОГАМ И ФИНАНСАМ ОМАР КВАРЧИЯ |publisher = [[Apsnypress]] |date = 11 June 2008 |accessdate = 17 August 2009 }}</ref> The resulting [[by-election]] was won by [[Emma Gamsonia]]. On 1 November 2010 Yuri Kereselidze died,<ref name=apsnypress1864>{{cite web |url = http://apsnypress.info/news/1864.html |title = Скончался депутат парламента Юрий Кереселидзе |publisher = [[Apsnypress]] |date = 1 November 2010 |accessdate = 17 January 2011 }}</ref> on 9 January 2011 Ruslan Kishmaria was elected his successor.<ref name=uzel179420>{{cite web |url = http://abkhasia.kavkaz-uzel.ru/articles/179420/ |title = В Гальском районе Абхазии состоялись досрочные выборы депутата парламента |publisher = [[Caucasian Knot]] |date = 10 January 2011 |accessdate = 17 January 2011 |language=Russian }}</ref>
On 8 February, [[Vladimir Nachach]] died after a long illness.<ref name=agov36424>{{cite news|title=CHAIRMAN OF PARLIAMENTARY COMMITTEE ON LEGISLATION, JUDICIAL AND LEGAL REFORM AND STATE BUILDING VLADIMIR NACHACH DIED AFTER SERIOUS ILLNESS|url=http://www.abkhaziagov.org/en/news/detail.php?ID=36424|accessdate=10 February 2011|newspaper=Administration of the President of the Republic of Abkhazia|date=8 February 2011}}</ref> On 9 March the Central Election Commission decided that the by-election to elect Nachach's successor would be held on 30 April, that formations who wished to nominate a candidate had to register between 11 and 31 March, and that candidates could be nominated between 31 March and 20 April.<ref name=apress2690>{{cite web |url = http://apsnypress.info/news/2690.html |title = 30 апреля состоятся досрочные выборы депутата парламента по Гудаутскому избирательному округу №16 |publisher = [[Apsnypress]] |date = 9 March 2011 |accessdate = 13 March 2011 }}</ref> Three candidates were nominated, all three by initiative groups: Kherson Dashelia, Zaur Avidzba and Said Argun.<ref name=apress2901>{{cite web |url = http://apsnypress.info/news/2901.html |title = ЦИК зарегистрировала трех кандидатов в депутаты парламента по Гудаутскому избирательному округу №15 |publisher = [[Apsnypress]] |date = 5 April 2011 |accessdate = 5 April 2011 |language=russian }}</ref> The by-election was won by Zaur Avidzba with 1028 votes, Said Argun came second with 753 votes and Kherson Dashelia third with 166 votes.<ref name=apress3126>{{cite web |url = http://apsnypress.info/news/3126.html |title = Заур Авидзба избран депутатом парламента по Гудаутскому избирательному округу №16 |publisher = [[Apsnypress]] |date = 3 May 2011 |accessdate = 7 May 2011 |language=russian }}</ref>
On 9 November 2011, Beslan Jopua's term as MP was terminated due to his appointment as Minister for Agriculture on 18 October by newly elected [[President of Abkhazia|President]] [[Alexander Ankvab]].<ref name=apress4675>{{cite news|title=Прекращены полномочия депутата парламента Беслана Джопуа|url=http://apsnypress.info/news/4675.html|accessdate=18 February 2012|newspaper=[[Apsnypress]]|date=9 November 2011}}</ref><ref name=apress4513>{{cite news|title=Беслан Джопуа назначен министром сельского хозяйства|url=http://apsnypress.info/news/4513.html|accessdate=18 February 2012|newspaper=[[Apsnypress]]|date=18 October 2011}}</ref>
